result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.   Defendant must successfully complete the two year probationary period in Taylor County Case No. 16CM11.
Defendant must undergo an AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement and on motion of the State, the court granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the State will move to dismiss the felony charge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Meranda L. Gehrke

ADDRESS INFO for Meranda L. Gehrke
Current: 310 E. Broadway Apt. 1, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2016)
Prior: W5711 Stetson Avenue #a, Stetsonville, WI 54480

Defendant Meranda L. Gehrke in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders that the warrants be quashed.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed with the court.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Statement by Attorney Nocco and Meranda Gehrke.   Court dismisses and read in count 2. Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and defers entry of judgment for two years upon satisfactory completion of the agrement - Count 1 will be dismissed.  - rt
Motion hearing on June 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Alec Phillip Nocco in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE not in court.  Atty Tlusty requests a warrant be issued.  Atty Nocco makes statement.  Court orders body only bench warrant. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Defendant may leave the State of Wisconsin April 5, 2016 through April 9, 2016 for son's wedding.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Meranda L. Gehrke in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Court orders a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant may leave the State of Wisconsin from April 5 through April 9 for her son's wedding.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  - rt
